intro: Antennaria compacta, commonly known as the dwarf mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and arctic regions. Antennaria compacta is characterized by its compact growth habit and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
